posts.content:
Gone are the days of normal influenza or viral fever…here’s a new entrant in the communicable diseases range. Don’t worry, it won’t make you sneeze but definitely boggle your mind- “if you know what it means?” Yes, it is the new SOCIAL MEDIA FEVER- a wave of creativity and innovative ideas upon which you can surf all day long! With the increasing rate of social media users and demand for the same, it is evidently becoming the most wanted domain in marketing a brand and its products. If you are not marketing yourself on social media hitherto then you must be from Pluto (*pun intended)!
Now, simply posting on social media platforms won’t hit the bull’e eye! A proper strategy is the key to success. Look outside the shell and there is huge market that is evolving like a ‘Pupfish’ and for keeping a pace, you need to think smart and fresh. It’s no secret that earlier social media marketing was a pale straightforward thing but as consumers are getting more socially savvy, their expectations are increasing day by day. Today they no longer just hope but somewhere indirectly demand for unique and innovative ideas from their preferred brands in order to keep them engaged socially.

Now, belonging to a digital and creative sector, we all know that keeping up with the trends and exploiting them is indeed time consuming but in contrast we have to act fast otherwise we will be left behind. So, for a fair idea, we’ve tracked and compiled few unique brands that are setting a milestone in digital marketing history. No doubt, they are enjoying big chunk of budgets and highly skilled professional team to Â¬complete a task but businesses of all sizes can replicate the tactics on a smaller scale as well. It just depends on the method of implementation.

These unique brands not only have their social media marketing strategy down pat but also their marketing approach will surely gonna inspire us all.

Oreo

Chocolate cookie with a white cream center…irresistible, isn’t it? Just hover around Oreo’s social media pages and you will discover way more than just the iconic cookie with a delectable cream filled center. In fact, you will get a chance to have a lavish visual treat of catchy videos and posts that are bound to capture your soul with the brand in unexpected ways.

They have 39 M likes and more than 6 lakh followers on FB and Twitter respectively. They have introduced so many wonderful campaigns till date. Let’s talk about their popular Wonderfilled Campaign. Throughout its Wonderfilled Campaign, Oreo has used 30 second short video clips to portray the situations so as to show what happens when a variety of people get their hands on an Oreo. Featuring from American hip hop recording artist Chiddy Bang to country music singer Kacey Musgraves to an ordinary little girl singing about the *sheer bliss* of sharing Oreo with her dad(the video clips), each video catered to a different set of audience with a specific theme. But there was a common factor in all of the videos, captivating the consumers/ viewers to share the videos on their social platforms.

In addition to the video clips, the tasty brand also offered ‘Snack Hacks’- a collection of Youtube videos of 10 seconds each that provided the viewers with some cool and fun ways to enjoy an Oreo. Nice topping! The videos were simple, crisp but effective at letting the viewer/ audiences know there’s innumerable ways they can enjoy their Oreo cookies rather than simply dunking it in a glass of milk.

Check their latest âPlay with Oreoâ campaign as well!

Here’s your ‘Takeaway’

With apps like Vine, Vimeo and Viddy, creating a short video to showcase your product or your brand has become a cakewalk now. Also, it’s not burning a hole in your pocket. Think of a theme/ idea/ concept, create a video and share the creation on social platforms- post it on Facebook, Tweet about it on Twitter and board it on Pinterest and let the social media bugs check that out.

Red Bull is an energy drink and their social media pages are brimmed with adventurous videos, posts and campaigns. Red Bull purposely uses content marketing and social media posts to create lifestyle that its consumers are thirsty for. If there’s any brand that understands its consumerâs persona,

it’s evidently Red Bull. The featured thrill-seeking athletes, rappers and race car drivers skillfully tout the brand

Website

Head to Red Bull’s FB and Twitter page and you’ll see about its fan going gaga over upcoming events or games. Their ‘photo of the week’ section gets huge footfall. The visitors talk, tweet, re-tweet, share and engage with the brand’s fun activities in full bloom. And if you want to experience the larger than life show then drop in on Red Bull TV. It will inescapably give you an adrenaline rush. They also offer a slew of apps just to add more thrill. Its social media isn’t just about their product- the energy drink but it’s about the consumer’s connect to the energetic world.

Here’s your Takeaway

So the crux is your social media pages must be relevant to your target audience so as to be effective in every sense. But for that understanding your buyersâ persona is the first step. Spend some time on your research and you are there!

TurboTax

This is one such global brand that has shown how to treat your unhappy customers and make them satisfied with the amendments. It’s true, happy or unhappy, as a brand both type of consumers/ customers are important for you. Actually, as the company deals with the most dreaded of things (taxes), a chunk of customers vent their dissatisfaction on their social platforms.

Website

Here comes the difference, instead of ignoring or hiding the negative comments/ feedbacks, TurboTax addresses every concern promptly. This uniqueness sets them apart from others as it is always increases the credibility of a brand when its customers get to know that they do care about them.

Here’s your Takeaway

Website

Here’s your Takeaway

Their strategy clearly shows how well they know the market and customer’s needs. The key is to sit down, jot down the goals, research, create posts and campaigns accordingly and hit your target audience.

All the mentioned brands’ strategy gave us a well-cooked ‘food for thought’. You can create your social media strategic recipe too but cook that in your style. It’s not any rocket science, just jot down your business goals, know whatâs in trend and get in action to hit hard. Social Media world will grow further, “make hay, while the sun shines”!

posts.title: Revamping website=Reinventing identities
posts.title_plain: Revamping website=Reinventing identities
posts.content:
We do style ourselves differently for different occasions or get a makeover from time to time, right? But have you ever thought about asking yourself, WHY? Why do we do change or update our look? Why do we dress differently? Why? “Mmmm…because we want to look different and trendy, as simple as that!”

Old and usual look is always boring and out of fashion whereas new and revamped look is always in trend and this exactly work for your company’s website as well. Do you remember those days when a company’s website was just about usual information about the products or services offered by it? Three words for the same- boring, boring and boring! With the new digital fever, brands across the globe have been on a revamping journey for their respective websites so as to raise the bar in terms of content onsite. Let’s have a look on a recent website re-launch of a global brand that made headlines-yes, we are talking about the launch of Coca Cola Journey by Coca Cola Great Britain in the mid of April, 2015. With the recent launch, this fizzy drink giant has secured a primitive position in the race of revamping the brand sites for attracting more footfalls. It replaces âCoca-Cola.co.ukâ which was earlier launched in June 2010.

The new site is “a new multimedia platform with a greater focus on storytelling”, according to official sources but in reality it is simply a rebranding, revamping and re-launch of its ‘.co.uk’ website. Since the launch of this particular site nearly five years ago, it has reportedly amassed more than 10 million unique visitors (organic reach) – quite an impressive number in terms of branding.

The Coca Cola Journey

(source- Google Images)

For the very first time, this new #Coke platform will bring together all aspects of Coca-Cola- the brand, from what they are doing as a brand and as the company as well (both globally and locally). The greater emphasis will be on ‘Storytelling’ that completely comprises of original content designed to tell the journey of Coca Cola so far in a much more fresh and engaging way. Not only that, the site will also cover the on-going global topics and social causes that will inevitably make the site a rich, socially enabled digital platform, featuring both branded and non-branded content. This is the current viral digital trend, to connect people emotionally, politically and socially with a dash of fun! Strumming the right strings, the editorial style of the platform focuses on providing credible and informative content that will educate the visitors without any hiccups.

#COKEJOURNEY

Marking the re-launch, the Coca Cola Great Britain’s official site now turned into a digital magazine includes exclusive content as follows:

  • An interactive Q&A section allowing the visitors to get insights about the products, ingredients and the expanding business. The visitors and the consumers can also submit their own queries, which will then be addressed by Coca-Cola Great Britain’s dedicated response team
  • The site promises an exclusive inside look at the ‘Rita Ora opening the Contour Bar in London’s Soho to mark the celebration of ‘100 years of Coke’s iconic Contour Bottle’. Adding a cherry on the cake, the site also features an interview with the brand ambassador will.i.am on his association with the brand. (given below the videos)
  • Blog post from Jon Woods, General Manager- Coca Cola Great Britain & Ireland about the actions being taken by Coke to help consumers reduce the sugar and calorie intake so as to be more physically active. Relishing taste buds is good but priorising health care is must, the brand understands the need completely.

The whole idea behind the re-launch of the site is to drive towards more multimedia and curated content, investing in videos and graphics and to work with a range of journalists, bloggers and writers for generating fresh and original content.

“Journey is the anchor of our digital storytelling strategy, sitting at the heart of our online ecosystem to foster engagement around our brands and our Company,” says Stanislas Magniant, Digital Communications Director, Coca-Cola North West Europe on the site re-launch. He further added, “The launch of Journey also gives us the opportunity to shift the way we communicate online. Through Journey we want to bring to life the stories about our Company, our brands, our employees and our actions around the world to tell our story in its entirety. We also want to make our stories more appealing, relevant and engaging to people by using the right multimedia content to bring them to life. And itâs not just about launching a new platform â we will ensure we are reaching our audiences online though our social media channels and meet our fans where they are online, not just on our site”.

Reviewing the all new revamped #Coke site, Andrew Canter, CEO of the Branded Content Marketing Association (BCMA) was quoted as saying, “When it comes to using branded content as a key cornerstone of their marketing strategy, Coca-Cola has been a trailblazer. They fully understand the power of storytelling, creating innovative and highly entertaining content which, in turn, translates into more happy customers and brand advocates. They have an inclusive culture that encourages people to share their experiences engendering a sense of community. This gives them a solid foundation on which their new Journey platform has been built”.

The re-launch also marks the merging of the @CokeZone Twitter feed with @CocaCola_GB with content reaching a giant figure of more than 100 K followers. Apart from the new content, the user experience in terms of browsing speed has also improved.

Get a ‘Makeover’

A company’s official website or the site (as we call it) should always be updated with new design and clear-crisp information about the services or product offerings, events, clientele, achievements, news e.tc. The new look and the updated information help potential and existing visitors in keeping themselves updated about the company and its business trends that ultimately helps in generating more business. The introduction of two way interactive platform keeps the visitors coming in time and again.

To revamp a website, a company primarily needs Usability experts and Creative experts. The Usability expert ensures the element on the page and its placement so that the visitor is guided with very less clicks to the important message sections saving a lot of time. On the other hand, a Creative expert helps with the layout, colour combination and the designing inputs to give an impressive look and feel for an amazing user experience. While revamping a company’s website, we should always take care of the content, images, technology used and the best way to achieve is to have an eye of a critic fused with the perspective of a user. It is also advisable to add Google map on the contact page as well for better location information.

Overloaded, huh??? Allow us to less the burden on your shoulders with a quick tour of our website.

The location, brand presence, skills, expertise, services, contact address, clientele information and so on…at one smooth go with cool colour combination and trendy designing so as to keep a pace with the trend and soothing user’s eyes at the same time. Visit us and be the judge!

Always remember, a company’s website is for others not for itself. Consumers always look for something new and want more, thus giving the brandâs website a new touch from time to time will keep the site and its popularity evergreen. As they, “Having a good website is one of the easiest ways to reach prospects, subsequently convert them into leads and ultimately into the deals. The fresh new look of your website can attract a good number of viewers at any given point of time”. It is time to ‘put the pedal to the metalâ and reinventing your brand identity with revamping the site.

posts.content:
Branding on the wheels of Online Media

“Entrepreneur, either your brand is distinct or your brand is distant.” – Onyi Anyado

A tubby little moppet in a red polka dotted dress singing utterly butterly delicious…sounds familiar, right? Yes, we are talking about the great Indian Amul Girl. The Amul Girl was not just the Amul Butter Mascot, it was a revolution in Indian branding history or rather say, a milestone!

The Amul Girl, who has entered the urban lore with interesting illustrations accompanied by clever catchphrases taking a sarcastic dig on contemporary events, stands for the very fight its Mother was born to counter. The cooperative Amul movement began in Gujarat back in the year 1946 was a movement against the atrocities of Polson Dairy (a locally owned dairy farm in Anand, Gujarat). The dairy allegedly procured milk from farmers at very low rates to sell to the then Bombay (now Mumbai) government. All thanks to late Dr Verghese Kurien, the Milkman of India, who came like an angel for helping out the poor local dairy farmers. Though his vision of dairy farmerâs centralised marketing and quality control facilities was quite simple but it was the prominent missing links in the Indian dairy economy at the time. They made it sure that their branding strategy reflects the objective they started with.

Over the years, Amul has maintained its image and it is the magic of their branding strategies. Talk about their brand elements, distribution of products and liquid milk, the supply chain, retailer ship and extending the product range outside the security of traditional milk products, milk powder and butter- every little yet significant strategies was properly planned and executed meeting the growing expectations/ needs of the country.

Their success is pretty visible; brand Amul is already present in over 50 countries with over 7,200 exclusive parlours in India only. Few simple yet powerful factors played significant roles in their success journey- the choice of Mascot, the brand name, the tagline, the famous jingle and relating the mascot with the ongoing issues. All of the elements were crafted in such a beautiful manner that today Amul has secured its place as a big brand in all media platforms and it’s all about their branding.

Now, a question arises- Is branding important and relevant in todayâs online world? With so much of digital platforms, do we still need branding strategies? The answer lies in these pictures:-

Amul as a brand is not limited up to the print and television but to the online world as well. Their social pages have a huge fan following which indirectly making their brand shine more. The exact idea of branding is not to become stagnant but to keep moving on. People and consumersâ needs and expectations are changing on a daily basis and they want brands to be like that. As a business owner you need to understand that consumers want more.

While some business owners think that branding is not nearly as relevant and vital as it was earlier, it’s hitherto an essential ingredient for the long term success of your company. However the fundamentals remain the same, the online branding has evolved considerably and the major fact is the proliferation of Internet, social media platforms and the mobile phones. Collectively, they have a vast impact on society and consumer behaviour that has changed the marketing sphere substantially for brands. Successful branding is no longer simply about creating a great meaningful logo or thinking of nice tagline or planning the most purposeful interesting advertising campaign possible.

(The McKinsey (and Google ZMOT) inspired Interbrand brand loyalty loop)

Branding in earlier days were different, let’s us start with the ancient ones. In ancient Babylon, to entice buyers to purchase goods that had arrived on ships, barkers solicited customers with a verbal (barked out) sales pitch describing spices, rugs, wines, and other goods.

Then came the newspaper ads, in 1625 in England, the first ad appeared in a newspaper. Unlike todayâs newspaper ads, early newspaper advertisements were limited to one section of the newspaper, and most were simple announcements. In order to attract readersâ attention, many newspaper advertisements repeated a line of copy several times. Later on, advertisements would appear anywhere in the newspaper depending upon the urgency and target reach, as they do today.

Then came the radio ads and with the advent of television, TV ads replaces all of them in terms of popularity.

Time went on and we reach the Google age. Before the Google age, as we like to name it, the branding choices businesses had to make were very limited and straightforward. It generally consisted of the yearly decision regarding the placement and ad type in the Yellow Pages listing, the budget and ad planning for advertisements in local newspapers, TV and perhaps some radio jingles. And that, pretty much, was the choice. But now, branding trends have evolved a lot and successful branding is all about a myriad of strategies, concepts and plans to be executed on online channelsâ fusing the tried and tested principles and an ever-evolving, agile adaptation tendency to the digital age we live in. True that! And the best example is the Xiaomi phone launch that created a rave on digital platforms.

Unlike other companies, who offers their handsets to consumers through physical stores, China’s Xiaomi decided to have an exclusive partnership with Flipkart (online only) to begin its flagship Mi smartphones sale far away from a crowded market place. A very unique and smart strategy that indeed cuts out overhead such as rent, salary of store staff and relevant IT infrastructure. Nevertheless, their smartphones reportedly break sale records. In the mobile phone market, Samsung kept the lead at 20.6 percent (from 25.7 percent in Q3 2013), followed by Nokia (Microsoft Devices) at 9.5 percent (from 13.8 percent), Apple at 8.4 percent (from 6.7 percent), LG at 4.2 percent (from 4.0 percent) and Huawei at 3.6 percent (3.0 percent) whereas sales of Xiaomi smartphones grew 20.3 percent to reach 301 million units by the end of 2014. A massive start for a new player!

Now that we have seen so many successful stories, we should know what online branding is all about, the goal, how it has evolved and why and how it is done in the digital age?

..and it’s a goal!

A brand is more than just a name, logo or a product. It is rather an idea that truly keeps the essence of your company. It is that gut reaction people have when they talk about your company or product. And how they think and feel is a result of both the tangible and intangible attributes of your brand that they perceive through their interactions and experiences. Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon.com, once said these amazingly true lines: “A brand for a company is like a reputation for a person. You earn reputation by trying to do hard things well”. The lines nail the fact that a reputation is really built on quality in the details.

May be the process of branding starts with defining, conveying and maintaining a brand’s core value but the ultimate bull’s eye is getting past the tangible attributes of your company (the who, what, when, where and how) and tapping into the emotional triggers of your consumers by conveying intangible attributes (the why factor) that are not easily imitated by the rest of the pack. Mostly, intangible attributes are felt emotions and regardless of the industry and practices, on a daily basis both B2B and B2C, people make decisions based as much on their feelings as logic.

The metamorphosis

Branding has changed because the consumers’ behaviour has changed and change keeps one young. In earlier times, branding was solely a one-way communication but today there are innumerable ways to expose people to your brand. No doubt, traditional media still is dear to everyone but now the preference has shifted to websites, social media, mobile apps, blogs, video and countless other digital channels.

The digital ear has fundamentally changed the way people have changed their shopping style. We can see a radical change in consumer’s purchasing priorities and decisions. According to many reports, 89% of purchasing decisions begin with a web search and B2C and B2B prospects alike are reading blogs, reviews, articles, websites, etc. It is now tech savvier and smarter. People are less likely to believe youâre the best choice just because you are claiming it! They have moved beyond traditional, interruption-based marketing messages and that is why, several years ago, as a marketing authority Seth Godin was amongst those first who pointed out that brands now need permission to engage their audience.

Your website is now your new identity, new face of the brand. “It only takes 50 millisecondsâa blink of the eyeâfor users to form an opinion about your website and therefore your brand”, as cited in Thomson Reuters Web of Science. You can love it or hate it but you can’t ignore the fact that your website is either working for your brand or against it.

Branding is no longer about a consumerâs exposure to your company but about their experiences and the various interactions they have with your brand. Your logos, browsing your website, interacting with your social pages engage the consumers in your brand interaction. Due to the social viral fever, a brand can be built up or torn down overnight and what else could be a better example than Starbucks.

Branding in digital age

Some fundamentals that you just can’t escape in today’s landscape:-

  • Be yourself: You have have to be different and the simplest way is to follow your rules. You need to show what makes your brand different from others. It might not be an unique quality but your brand identity is your brand authenticity. Like Amul has maintained its identity with its Mascot and tagline-“Amul the taste of India”.
  • Touching emotions work wonders: As BMW has said, “We realized a long time ago that what you make people feel is just as important as what you make.”
  • “Ummedon wali dhoop, sunshine wali aasha…” Coke’s ad. It is the best possible and trusted way to brand your company and the results are inevitably wonderful especially in countries like India.
  • I understand my audience: This attitude with a topping of digital approach is the recipe. Your audience likely spends the majority of their media consumption online, whether blogs, social media, news sites, websites or email. Purchasing behavior has changed dramatically and you need pull the right chord.
  • The smart hard work: Personalise the experience, pull your consumers in (push is the new strategy. Consumers want to add value not the volume), listen carefully and then respond and create a space for them to keep coming back.

Break the conventions and embrace the new digital ways for branding yourself. Yes, it is still relevant and with so many platforms, brand building is the new age partner for companies.

posts.title: New profound love for Digital Marketers
posts.title_plain: New profound love for Digital Marketers
posts.content:
Penning a blog about the trending video content in digital marketing is in itself an irony. However, there is no denying that people now-a-days are too busy to read through a complete lengthy article or any written piece. Nobody wants to stick to the screens for hours and hours and that is the sole reason why the online written content has become more precise and exclusive pointer oriented. Several stats suggest that people are getting inclined towards easily accessible, interesting and informative video content or do we say the trend has already started!

Back in the year 2010, in the month of February, a campaign took the whole online community by storm and marked its name in the history of world’s biggest campaign with golden letters. Any guesses? Yes, it was Old Spice’s ‘The Man You Man Could Smell Like’ campaign. It was more than an addiction; it was more of a benchmark in online viral fever. No viral video chart would be complete without this piece of gem. With innumerous hilarious follow, shares and comments on this quirky video, this campaign made Old Spice the brand that marketers everywhere wanted to work with. This original video has approximately 50.5 M views to date.

Walking on the same track, another video that created similar rave amongst neti-zens was ‘Metro Trains Melbourne Dumb Ways to Die’. In November 2012, one fine day people suddenly woke up to reality and the dumbness involved in it. One of the most innovative public safety videos ever, dumb ways to die was a huge hit on internet and there have since been numerous sequels to it. The original has an amazing 102.6 M views on YouTube and the campaign won numerous awards worldwide.

Enough to prove the significance and popularity of online videos for marketing purposes! Evidently, online videos work wonders for digital marketing!

It is a scientifically proven fact that human brains grasp visual content more rapidly as what the eyes see, reflex action is likely to transmit that information to brain more prominently. The video content is easy to understand and at the same time it is appealing as well considering the very fact that it contains visuals. No wonder why so many digital/ social media platforms are incorporating the video sharing and recording feature. Amongst the latest example, talk about Twitter- who just added a video recording facility to their direct messaging feature. You can surely guess now, what is trending rapidly.

(Source- Nielson)

If we go by a study conducted by Cisco, by the year 2017, 69% of consumers on the World Wide Web would be consuming video content only. And to meet up their expectations, close to 65% marketers are focussing on running their campaigns dominated thoroughly by video content.

(Source- Youtube)

Let’s take a quick look at You-tube statistics as their statistical figures are extremely dominant being one of the largest search engines in the world.

  • Users: You-tube is experiencing a record number of over 1 billion unique users every month
  • Uploading: You-tube receives over 130 hours (approx) of videp uploads every minute
  • Views: Over 6 billion hours worth of videos are being watched by users across the globe, in just a span of 30 days

Below the graph is showing the percentage of online video consumption and the power of the same distinctly.

(Source- Google)

What is even more interesting to watch is that popular social media channels which already allowed sharing visuals, such as Instagram also introduced video recording and sharing facility.

Other big video sharing platforms like Vine and Vimeo have a huge fan base. Now, the question arises that why do we prefer videos above any other form of content? Below are some key reasons:-

  • Visuals are processed 60,000X faster in the brain than any form of text and thus 90% of information transmitted to the brain is visual
  • Videos on landing pages reportedly increase the average page conversion rates by 88%. People who visits the page, share it on their social platforms, like it, comment on it, starts conversation, write reviews and update their knowledge parallely
  • Videos are not only social media ready but friendly too. They are easy to access, share and and extremely palatable in nature
  • Posts with interesting videos receive 96% more engagement than those without
  • 63% of audiences and consumers are more likely to click on a business page whose videos appear in search engine results and Youtube is great example in this regard. Not to stop here, around 69% consumers give more weightage to clear and detailed videos instead of customer ratings
  • Videos show your products directly thus allowing the consumers/ visitors to make their decisions without any prior pressure and manipulation
  • Videos break through the brimming clutter of online content as it conveys the message spontaneously
  • Videos are becoming as easy to make as porridge with many editing software available

In this digital era, where marketing strategies today concentrate on attractive and informative content, online videos has taken over all the other forms of communication. One more reason to switch to the online video marketing is, as per the deprecation policy, Google Blog Search was shut down on May 26, 2014. So, what are you waiting for? Think, create and get goingnew profound love indeed!

posts.title: Digital Marketing: Think beyond SEO and Ad-Words
posts.title_plain: Digital Marketing: Think beyond SEO and Ad-Words
posts.content:
Now-a-days, people have access to ample amount of information at any time and at any place, all thanks to the internet and globalisation. Now it has become a cake walk for most of the people to access the desired information via computers, tablets and the newest companion in town- smartphones.

The business owners should remember that any active netizen can influence the image of their companies via social media platforms and it is a universal truth that your customer’s feedback will be way more trustworthy and credible for other visitors to read than your own one.

This is where; Digital Marketing enters as a big influencer. It is becoming important day by day as it is only via the electronic mediums and by getting positive feedbacks from the customers about your product/ company, you can easily attract new foot fall and thus build long lasting relationship. However you need to take care of the communication process as it work both ways! Happy customers could help you in an increase in sales but on the other hand, unhappy customers can harm your business very seriously and you can’t even ignore them as they are also a part of the clientele. That is the reason why as a business owner, you need to rethink and restyle some vital digital marketing factors. Those factors which are already known to us but with the growing market needs, we need to look at it a bit differently. Before stepping on to those factors, let’s us briefly know about the emerging importance of content marketing.

Content Marketing: Fresh factor in driving online business

Gone are the days when SEO and Google Ad Words brought most of the customers to the website. The new era of digital marketing aims to engage and delight customers through meaningful content and conversations rather than bombarding them with not-so-useful ads and keywords (sometimes jargons).

A proper meaningful discussion and research about the content (what should go and what not) decide the ultimate consequences. Smart, precise and ‘to the point’ discussion and thinking helps a lot as it drives the whole engagement and thus the encouragement.

Old wine in a new bottle
  • Boost the engagement and participation via digital media: Digital Media is not only about tweeting, tagging or making friends. It is a universal platform where people with same wavelength connect with each other. It is about creating a web of information. Digital media is the easiest way possible for acquiring new clients and generating foot fall. You just need to segment them into different customer groups based on their preferences. Later, you will be able to interact with them and encourage/lead to various actions.

There is a huge scope in social media itself, you just need to open up. Take the example Red Bull, the energy drink. Red Bull is a great example of a brand built almost entirely on social media, with some mind-blowing strategy thrown in for good measure. It is a known fact that having a target group in mind while planning your marketing, helps a lot. People who drink Red Bull are adrenaline junkies or, more importantly, they’re people who want to be adrenaline junkies so their target audiences are youth and adventurous people (primarily).

Let’s have a look at some of their videos

(source- Youtube)

There is a common factor in all of the videos- ‘It gives you an adrenaline rush, you feel like trying it too’. So, this is an excellent example of segmenting your audiences and engaging them via digital media.

  • It’s not all about ‘LIKES': We stick to Red Bull here again! We all know that social media or digital media marketing isn’t just about racking up loads of ‘likes’, but 43m fans is still a very impressive number. But what’s next??? Likes and shares are not enough because after a point, monotony will replace the excitement. As a business owner, you need to understand that people somehow want to get inspired by the posts. So, we need to look at the factor that how we can benefit the audiences. Red Bull is not limited to one page or one idea. They have a number of dedicated social pages for their different initiatives- like the Stratos balloon jump (850,000 fans), X-Fighters (940,000) and its Music Academy (112,000).

They understand that beyond ‘likes’ and ‘shares’, there is a world where people want a fresh factor to which they could relate themselves. If you regularly observe their page then you’d be hard pushed to find any post that actually include an image of a Red Bull can. Instead the wall posts focus on images and videos of extreme sports and athletes sponsored by Red Bull. It fits with the brands overall strategy of promoting itself as a lifestyle choice rather than a simple, caffeinated drink. As a result of posting these eye catching images, the post frequently clock up tens of thousands of ‘likes’ and hundreds of comments. People start interacting with each other sharing their own experiences and this is what, is the call of the hour.

Likes are equally proportional to sales. Once purposeful likes are there, the sales will automatically rise up

  • A step ahead of the competitors in market: With the sudden grip up of digital marketing, each and every year businesses concentrates and spends huge amount on SEO, Google Adwords or Social Media resources giving up on the conventional rules. This is the sole reason of the increasing competition. To have a good knock off in the competitive market being updated on

‘what’s new’ becomes a necessity. Keeping a tab of the latest trend in the digital market is important as it gives you an insight of whatever happening so that you get a fair chance to track your competitors’ marketing strategies while learning and improving your own.

  • Breaking frontiers

When the whole world is moving ahead, why not to walk along? Understand that digital marketing doesn’t only apply to your website or your business! Just creating a website or an e-Commerce portal or investing in SEO or Ad-Words is partially workable. The real and practical factor is the content strategy and planning. You need to stand out from the rest and for transfusing your goals into visible results; you need a proper strategy that puts potential customers first. There is no place for mundane and redundant stuff on digital media, people want something new and out of the league. For that you need to learn any rocket science but think of simple yet powerful messages. There is no dearth of ideas and being the supreme creature of God, you can do anything you want.

Let’s suppose a company is launching its new product and want to trend it on social media or for that matter anybody wants their post/ blog to be viewed on a large scale. Now, how will they do it? Heard of #Hashtags, sure you have had. A hashtag is a label for content. It helps others who are interested in a certain topic, quickly find content on that same topic and thus creating a network of information collected from different origins and zones. Why not to take the leverage of it. There are no such barriers in social media, so just search for the trending #hashtags and post something relevant and catchy with the link of your product at the end. Not 100% but at least 25% people will be driven to your website without any extra cost. Try it!

  • Business reputation comes first: For any business to get successful, good reputation is an essential ingredient. Without the trust and confidence of the customer, a company will not survive. Especially in the past years the importance of reputation has become increasingly noticeable. If a business has a good reputation, customers may choose that particular company above many others in the market. The positive reputation enables marketers to differentiate their products/services in a highly competitive market and successfully compete with big players.

For building a good reputation in the market, make sure you communicate with your visitors/ customers and everyone out there who have, on an average regular presence and interaction on your website e-mail and Social pages. The communication should be two way i.e they have the opportunity to post in their queries and you as a responsible business owner answer their doubts asap. You can offer help as well and collectively these simple yet vital steps will ensure that it bridges the gap and build a long-lasting relationship between you and your customer.

posts.title_plain: Mobile Optimisation and Google Algorithm Change: Smart steps to stay Friendly
posts.content:
As discussed in the previous blog, Google will be updating the algorithm for search engine ranking from April 21, 2015. Google continuously works to update its search algorithms to better meet the needs of its users while websites engage in a perpetual struggle to optimise their content according to the latest Google algorithms.

The unprecedented announcement of the change has purposely provided to site owners beforehand with time they need to prepare for upcoming changes. So, why not to take advantage of it?

Mobile in the growth of e-commerce

Considering that mobile now comprises of more than one-fifth of the e-commerce market, making these changes should not only help companies successfully navigate the changes, but also help them capitalise on the ever-growing mobile marketplace.

Let’s look at some key figures

Types of mobile use

(Source: Shopatron Retailer eCommerce Study)

e-Commerce Growth

(Source: strangeloop)

Sale and Purchase ratio

(Source: global web index)

*Note: All figures are in approximate value

Before implementation, just think about your desired customer and the actions they are likely to perform on your mobile site. Are they there to research or find merchandise? Are they looking up an address or phone number on the way to your restaurant? Mobile search now accounts for about 60 percent of online traffic to websites, and people use their devices to complete a myriad of tasks. Consider all the possible actions customers might take from a mobile device and use these ideas to guide the planning of the mobile site and the navigation menu. Just a smart way of logical thinking with few friendly steps and you are there! But before stepping on to the steps needed to face off the change, let’s have a brief understanding of Google will be looking at:-

  • The fonts scale for easy reading on smaller screens
  • If the touch elements, such as buttons, are easy to use and spaced away from other properly (touch elements)
  • If the website relies on Flash, which tends to not play well in mobile browsers – the Google-bot must be allowed to crawl CSS & JavaScript
  • If you have separate mobile URLs, you must redirect mobile users on each desktop URL to the appropriate mobile URL
  • Avoidance of irrelevant cross-links – This is when users are linked to desktop-optimized pages from the mobile version of the site, and vice versa
  • Slow mobile pages and load time

Note: It is an important point to keep in mind that mobile friendliness is driven by the page level, not a particular site wise. And Google is currently considering upon the dedicated mobile index.

A lot of people face issues while scrolling down to read or gather information or have to potentially zoom in to solve the purpose but with a smartly designed mobile friendly website, this potential hassle becomes a cake walk. Some friendly ways to stay friendly with Google’s upcoming algorithm.

The new ‘Mantra': Mobile ready is Mobile friendly
  • Audit: The first and foremost step to follow is to audit your website for mobile friendliness as soon as possible. This will help you know the barriers in the pathway
  • Analyse the mobile share of voice, have a look at the competitive sites and then compare your site for ‘where you stack up and rank as mobile optimisation from April 21 will be a new competitive sub market
  • Follow the Google Guru! Optimise and walk on the foot prints of Google best practices or think other way around- “You have been WARNED by Google, right?”
  • Search and track for the latest keyword trends and mobile site rankings across device type such as desktop, mobile, and tablet
  • Measure the rankings and the outcomes at a page level
  • After the search and measure part, comes the reporting part. Report for keyword trends and rankings across device type for local and global results
  • Once you overcome the above steps, refine and fine tune the six elements with regard to your mobile strategies, approach, and tactics
Google at your service

You might be thinking that you are suddenly loaded with so much of burden but this isn’t true if you think wise. To cater to this problem, you just need to open your thinking space. Google itself offers two fantastic tools that allow you to test your website to see how well it performs on mobile devices. The first is the ‘Mobile Usability Report’ that is found in your ‘Google Webmaster Tools’. The second is a Mobile-Friendly Test that can be run on a specific page URL. Use these two tools to gain a better understanding of how mobile-friendly your site already is and where your main challenges lie.

Mobiles are one of the best companions of humans and that is why it is becoming an urgent need to well optimise the mobile sites as it always make easy for customers to find the information they seek and complete their desired tasks on mobile devices itself, saving time and energy both.

Just like with SEO, content marketing, and search engines- usually don’t chase the Google algorithm change but create content for the user as they are the one you want to reach out. In the case of mobile optimisation, don’t chase the green icon but design it for the mobile user, follow Google’s best practices and you will find that being friendly and an avid follower, pays off.

posts.title_plain: Google Algorithm Change: The next big update from the Internet Moghul
posts.content:
April 21, 2015- a big day for marketers worldwide, wondering why??? Let’s go a little back in the month of February. On February 26, 2015, the internet giant Google gave an incredible insight into changes they have planned for their search algorithms and the finalised date for the implementation of the same. They specifically announced that from April 21 onwards, mobile search engine result pages (popular as SERPs) will be hugely impacted by the mobile friendliness aspect of a particular website.

We all living in a smartphone era and according to several surveys, mobile phone users are increasing at a swift rate. Even if we concentrate on India only, the figures are augmenting like mushrooms.

A quick view

(Survey source- @wearesocialsg)

Google simply wants to make it easier for mobile users to access the desired websites and that can be only achieved by optimising the website for use on mobile devices. They have given a forewarning about an impending change and the day of occurrence to all website owners. Now, if you are a website owner then you should head back to your site dashboards and take few points into account that cannot be skipped!

What should be expected?

As of April 1, 2015, there are reportedly more than 1.5 billion mobile Internet users across the globe. Apart from this, around 80% of internet users own a smartphone. Now, if these figures are not good enough to ring a bell so that you move towards taking leverage of the growing mobile search trend then Google’s algorithm change is the final push you need.

Talking about the effect this algorithm change will have on SERPs, Google has purposely mentioned that there would be a “substantial impact on organic search results”. In this way, Google has indeed encouraged the website owners to take into account mobile users for a while now, hinting that they would be prioritised. Until recently the scenario was different as it has been possible for websites to perform well without worrying too much about mobile optimization.

The trend will likely to change dramatically and will start gripping up post April 21. Those who have not taken necessary steps ensuring their websites to be mobile ready can undoubtedly expect their mobile rankings hit hard. For any businesses or marketers, this can ultimately result in a major dip in income or sales.

Thinking of this major issue, Google has deliberately made this ‘soon to be launched update’ news public so that the site owners have the opportunity to prepare themselves beforehand. You have to always keep this point in mind that the ultimate goal of Google search engine mechanism is to provide the end users with the desired information without any errors and omissions. If your website has valuable information and is now mobile friendly as well, it will comparatively perform well because you are meeting up the users’ expectations. posts.title_plain: Digital Marketing: Changing the game for businesses
posts.content:
Digital Marketing: Changing the game for businesses

“Overnight the digital age had changed the course of history for our company. Everything that we thought was in our control no longer was. But within a year we had invested in social media, digital experts and digital marketing. Now Starbucks is the number one brand on Facebook”, Howard Schultz, Chairman/CEO, Starbucks.

Remember the sudden fall of Starbucks. The company was in dire straits, the comparable store sales had gone negative but Howard Schultz had made the impossible, possible with smart skills and digital expertise.

In today’s digital era, digital marketing is the call of the hour for businesses. The whole rise, fall and revival story of Starbucks had shown the importance of digital marketing for businesses to grow and develop. It is undoubtedly one of the key buzzwords in the business domain. Unlike the conventional and traditional forms of marketing, digital marketing involves well-planned strategies to engage consumers and to drive brand conversation on various digital channels, ranging from email to mobile applications.

Digital Marketing has evolved a lot since its inception and now, more than ever, businesses are finding it difficult to ignore the need to incorporate digital marketing as part of their longer term business strategies.

Back in the year 2010, the BBC produced a documentary with an intriguing theme-‘Virtual Revolution’. The documentary explored how 20 years of exposure to the digital world has dramatically altered our day to day lives.

BBC Virtual Revolution Documentary Intro

The first episode and the subsequent episodes of BBC Virtual Revolution Documentary

(source-YouTube)

The documentary exactly examined and portrayed the impact of World Wide Web has had on the society.

After almost 26 years since the budding process, digital marketing has now become a part and parcel of businesses all around the world as on a daily basis people are devoting their time on Internet.

Digital Marketing: An overview
It bridges consumers and businesses
  • Digital marketing encourages engagement via digital media: Unlike the conventional practises, you can now simply acquire new clients through the massively popular Social Media Channels. Sit on a chair, open your laptop and you are there!
  • The electronic medium/ channels play a vital role: Thanks to the Internet and Globalisation! Breaking the physical barriers, most of the people today on the globe are able to access any information at any time and anyhow with the help of mobiles, computers or tablets.
  • Consumers’ feedback on digital media can turn the whole business game: Remember for any business, feedback of the consumers is extremely poignant as the feedback is solely responsible for shaping up the business.
Digital Marketing: A catalyst

Remember the role of a catalyst in a chemical reaction, for e.g.- iron in the manufacturing of ammonia (Haber process). A catalyst basically speeds up the reaction process and increases the rate of productivity. Digital Marketing acts exactly like a catalyst for your business reach and visibility in the digital domain.
